strapiPost.title: Flip The Switch
strapiPost.content:
The annual Lights of the Ozarks is this coming weekend! We don’t know about you, but we’re pumped. 

  • Hard work: The City of Fayetteville Parks and Recreation Department will have spent over 2000 hours decorating the downtown square with over 500,000 lights just in time for the lighting ceremony Nov. 19 at 6p. 
  • Tis the season: Right after the switch is flipped on Friday, the Lighting Night Parade will commence on their new route to kick off the season. Each year the Lights of the Ozarks embody the holiday spirit, shining from 5p-1a each evening until Jan. 1, 2022. Don’t miss the festivities complete with treats, hot cocoa, and music!

More more details, click HERE.
